thread.title: Area Roundup: Morris soccer falls to Sycamore
thread.title_full: Area Roundup: Morris soccer falls to Sycamore

title: Area Roundup: Morris soccer falls to Sycamore
text:
Area Roundup: Morris soccer falls to Sycamore Published: Thursday, Oct. 1, 2015 10:36 p.m. CDT By: STAFF REPORTS 
SYCAMORE – The Sycamore boys soccer team concluded senior night by extending its undefeated conference record after defeating Morris, 2-0, Thursday night. Related Links Area Roundup: Morris soccer falls to Sycamore 
Sycamore (13-4-1 overall, 5-0 Northern Illinois Big 12 East) had a goal in both halves. 
Forward Matthew Coulibaly started the scoring in the 14th minute when his shot deflected off of Morris’ keeper Matt Borgstrom. 
Phillip Maillefer capped the victory with his goal in the fourth minute of the second half. 
The Spartans had their share of shots on goal during the game – totaling four in the first half and five in the second – but two goals is all it took to take down Morris, which totaled just three shots. 
The Spartans have six seniors, and according to head coach David Bachta, they have had an obvious impact. 
“It’s all about the commitment they have shown.” Bachta said. “When you look at the change in the program as far as wins go, that really comes from them. They’ve worked hard all summer and throughout the season and that kind of work ethic rubs off on some of the younger guys.” 
While Sycamore reflected on the senior leadership they have, Morris (6-10-0, 0-5) is playing with a thin roster that included just a handful of substitutes and even a few players who moved over at halftime from the junior varsity game on the adjacent field. 
“We were hanging with them in the first half, but our problem all year has been the depth on our roster.” Morris coach David Valdivia said. “We have seven sophomores playing up on varsity right now, so its tough right now, but next year they’re going to be really tough to beat because they’re getting the valuable experience right now.” 
VOLLEYBALL 
Morris 25-25, Geneseo 13-16: Kaylin Korte led Morris (8-13-2) to an NI Big 12 crossover win with 17 kills, five digs, two blocks and an ace. 
Janelle Brehm added four kills, five digs and two aces, while Veronica Johnson had three blocks, one kill and one dig. 
Addison Polite had 15 assists, four digs and one ace, while Ashley Hood had seven assists and three digs. 
Morris won the sophomore match, 20-25, 25-10, 25-18, lost the freshman A match, 27-25, 20-25, 25-17, and won the freshman B match, 25-17, 25-20.
